title: How to Randomize a Pokémon Game

steps.title: Make sure that you have a ROM and an emulator.
steps.content: Make sure that you have a ROM and an emulator. In order to randomize a Pokémon game, you'll need a ROM for the Pokémon game, and an emulator installed on your Windows or Mac computer is required to play the game. [1] X Research source You can download both ROMs and emulators from places like LoveROMS ( https://www.loveroms.online/ ) and EmuParadise ( https://www.emuparadise.me/ ). You cannot randomize a Pokémon game while playing on a console or a mobile platform.

steps.title: Download the Universal Randomizer application.
steps.content: Download the Universal Randomizer application. Go to http://pokehacks.dabomstew.com/randomizer/downloads.php in your computer's web browser , then click the download link for your operating system (if you're using an OS other than windows (such as Mac), you'll click the Download for all other platforms link). The Universal Randomizer supports randomizing Pokémon games from generation one all the way through every game in generation five (e.g., Pokémon Black Version 2 and White 2).

steps.title: Install the Universal Randomizer application.
steps.content: Install the Universal Randomizer application. This process will vary slightly depending on whether you're using Windows or a Mac computer: [2] X Research source Windows - Open the downloaded ZIP folder, click Extract , click Extract all , and click Extract . Mac - Make sure that you have the Java JDK installed, then double-click the downloaded ZIP folder and wait for it to extract.

steps.title: Open Universal Randomizer.
steps.content: Open Universal Randomizer. Double-click the randomizer item inside of the unzipped folder. The Universal Randomizer window will open. On a Mac, the Universal Randomizer is a Java file, meaning that it resembles a coffee cup.

steps.title: Click Open ROM.
steps.content: Click Open ROM . It's in the upper-right side of the Universal Randomizer window. Clicking it prompts a File Explorer (Windows) or a Finder (Mac) window to open. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Select your ROM.
steps.content: Select your ROM. Go to the file location of your ROM, then click it to select it.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . It's in the lower-right side of the window. Doing so will import your ROM file into the Universal Randomizer, which will unlock the various randomizer options on the page.

steps.title: Randomize your preferred aspects of your ROM.
steps.content: Randomize your preferred aspects of your ROM. Checking the "Random" or "Randomize" box below each Pokémon heading will completely randomize the game, while selecting only a few random options will create a more familiar experience. Most randomized aspects allow you to select additional traits. For example, if you choose to randomize the "Pokémon Base Statistics" section, you can still have the Pokémon progress along their evolution cycles by checking the "Follow Evolutions" box.

steps.title: Click Randomize (Save).
steps.content: Click Randomize (Save) . It's in the upper-right side of the page. Doing so will bring up a save window.

steps.title: Save your ROM.
steps.content: Save your ROM. To do so: Select a save location. [4] X Research source Enter a file name. Click Save Click Yes when prompted.

steps.title: Play your randomized ROM.
steps.content: Play your randomized ROM. Once your randomized ROM is saved, you can play it like any other ROM file: Open your emulator. Click File Click Open Double-click your ROM.

steps.title: Understand how this method works.
steps.content: Understand how this method works. Pokémon generations 6 and 7 include games like X, Y, Sun, and Moon, all of which have been notoriously difficult to randomize. Luckily, you can use a randomizer called PK3DS and a tool called PackHack to randomize some aspects of these games. Unfortunately, the PK3DS randomizer is only available for Windows computers.

steps.title: Make sure that you have an emulator and a ROM.
steps.content: Make sure that you have an emulator and a ROM. You'll need an emulator that is capable of playing 3DS games, such as Citra, and you'll need a 3DS ROM for your preferred Pokémon game to go along with your emulator. You can find torrents for 3DS ROMS, but most popular ROM sites don't carry 3DS ROM files that can be downloaded directly. Citra is a popular choice for a 3DS emulator: https://citra-emu.org/

steps.title: Download the PK3DS randomizer.
steps.content: Download the PK3DS randomizer. This randomizer can support most games from Pokémon generation 6 and some games from generation 7: Open the PS3DS download link on your computer and follow the instructions listed there.

steps.title: Extract the PK3DS files.
steps.content: Extract the PK3DS files. To do so: Right-click the downloaded ZIP folder. Click Extract All... Click Extract Double-click the pk3DS Build 337 ZIP folder. Click Extract at the top of the window. Click Extract all Click Extract when prompted.

steps.title: Download and install Pack Hack.
steps.content: Download and install Pack Hack. This program is necessary in order to save your 3DS ROM as a new, randomized version: Go to https://github.com/Asia81/HackingToolkit9DS/releases in your computer's browser. Click PackEnglishV12.rar Extract the Pack Hack RAR file .

steps.title: Open the PackHack folder.
steps.content: Open the PackHack folder. Double-click the extracted PackEnglishV12 folder, double-click the only folder inside, and then double-click PackHack .

steps.title: Place your 3DS file inside of the PackHack folder.
steps.content: Place your 3DS file inside of the PackHack folder. Copy the 3DS file by clicking it and pressing Ctrl + C , then press Ctrl + V while in the PackHack folder.

steps.title: Double-click SetupUS.
steps.content: Double-click SetupUS . It's in the PackHack folder. Doing so will prompt the 3DS file to begin extracting.

steps.title: Copy the entire folder's files.
steps.content: Copy the entire folder's files. When the setup is done running, click one file, press Ctrl + A , and press Ctrl + C to copy everything that's in the PackHack folder.

steps.title: Paste the files into a new folder.
steps.content: Paste the files into a new folder. Create a new folder in the same place as the extracted PackEnglishV12 folder (e.g., the Desktop), open the new folder, and press Ctrl + V .

steps.title: Open PD3DS.
steps.content: Open PD3DS. Double-click the pk3DS application file to do so. The PK3DS program window will open. If you see a pop-up window alerting you that PK3DS is an "unknown program", click More info , then click Run anyway at the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File . It's in the top-left corner of the window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . You'll see this option in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Open the new folder that you just made.
steps.content: Open the new folder that you just made. Double-click the new folder to do so.

steps.title: Select your ROM.
steps.content: Select your ROM. Click the 3DS game here.

steps.title: Click OK or Open.
steps.content: Click OK or Open . Your selected ROM will open in the PK3DS emulator.

steps.title: Randomize your game.
steps.content: Randomize your game. Once you've opened the 3DS ROM in PK3DS, you can randomize specific attributes for the game in question by selecting a tab at the top of the window (e.g., ExeFS ), selecting an attribute (e.g., Shiny Rate ), and modifying your preferred options in the resulting pop-up window.

steps.title: Leave PK3DS open when saving your file.
steps.content: Leave PK3DS open when saving your file. You'll need to do a couple of things in order to save your 3DS file as a randomized game, so make sure that you don't close PK3DS during this time.

steps.title: Copy the new folder's extracted ROM folder.
steps.content: Copy the new folder's extracted ROM folder. Open the folder that you created, click the ExtractedRomFS folder, and press Ctrl + C .

steps.title: Paste the file into the PackHack folder.
steps.content: Paste the file into the PackHack folder. Re-open the PackHack folder that's inside of the PackEnglishV12 folder, then press Ctrl + V and choose to replace the conflicting file name.

steps.title: Double-click the HackingToolkit option.
steps.content: Double-click the HackingToolkit option. It's in the PackHack folder. This will open a Command Prompt window.

steps.title: Rebuild the Pokémon 3DS file.
steps.content: Rebuild the Pokémon 3DS file. Do the following in the Command Prompt window: [5] X Research source Type d and press ↵ Enter Type in a unique, one-word name (no spaces) for your Pokémon ROM, then press ↵ Enter . Press any key when prompted.

steps.title: Play your randomized ROM.
steps.content: Play your randomized ROM. Once the rebuilding is complete, you can open the randomized 3DS file in your preferred emulator.
